basics.name: Jonnald Hernandez
basics.label: Student and Aspiring Software Engineer
basics.summary: A passsionate programmer always willing to learn

work.name: S-SMART Summer Research Program
work.summary: Research internship supported by SFSU and local community colleges for community college students to gain research and engineering experience
highlights: Learned the fundamentals of machine learning, such as forward/backward propagation, matrix manipulation, and optimization
Developed and trained a large language model with Mistral 7b named Tutor.ai with a team of interns and mentor
Pre-processed textbook and class-specific data into Tutor.ai for end-users in class
Designed a website for Tutor.ai, using technologies such as React and HTML/CSS.

volunteer.summary: Take on the same responsibilities of the president, such as overseeing club operations, planning club events, recruiting members, and collaborating with other clubs.
highlights: Developed the Skyline Computer Science Club website with the club officers, using technologies such as React and Node.js

courses: COMP 252 - Intro to Object-Oriented Programming: C++

awards.title: 1st Place: Skyline Datathon
awards.summary: Won first place with a team of 6 members by designing an analytical project to recommend road safety changes based on a given crash dataset. Analyzed and made meaning of crash data in California by county, obtaining numerical and visual insights using the Python libraries: pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib.

projects.name: Snake Game
projects.description: Developed a snake game using Python and tkinter, showing proficiency in class-oriented/functional programming, and code design
